Hi guys  just wanna check for minimum spend (for rewards or monthly for cashback)  do we usually need to meet inclusions and exclusions list? Or just any spending to hit that amount can count?(mainly checking for first-time rewards  yuu's 600 and mb fnf 800 monthly)
exclusions list usually wont count towards min spend. If you meant non bonus category spend  dbs yuu still counts as eligible spends towards 600$ req.
is it work with recurring payment on CRMC?
For DBS YUU if i use it to pay SP Utilities   does it count towards the $600 minimum spend?
Split payment for high value items to earn more rewards? You may need to bring physical cards for verification in the future.https://youtu.be/AnFfsfR_5Qc?si=K5dH3hA7VzW4_dVg
Seems like good practice. Probably to verify the name same for all the cards.

Anyone went to Tiger's Project Play last weekend to sign up for the 6.8% p.a return? They told me have to wait 24 Nov for the 6.8% coupons and $100 shopping vouchers to be in. That's like an extra 10 business days returns lost earning only 3% p.a parking at Philips Money Market . What's the overall nett return after including non business days and 9-23 Nov?
Lol. I withdraw immediately after deposit
So nett return is about 4.5% p.a before including the period 9-23 Nov. Still better than chocolate and hsbc I guess
I am not sure when they start to calculate â€œ6.8%â€. The day you deposit or the day you apply the coupon. If excluded 9-23 Nov  return will be a bit lower than 4.5%-4.6%.I did not participate.
That's why deposit 10k is good enough.
But u withdraw immediately after deposit  do u still get the $100 shopping vouchers?
Of course. Read terms and conditions. It doesn't ask you to hold. Only ask you to make a deposit
Have to do 10trades before you can withdraw the 6.8%.
That day I asked the staff on site  she say wouldn't get if withdraw prior receiving their email with shopping voucher
They just want you to hold without withdrawing.  Anyway you don't need. Just read through the whole T&C . Even term and conditions doesn't say anything about holding it
4.5%/4.6% is still a good interest rate. Most banks do not offer this rate anymore.
I got 5.5% from (6.8%*60/90+2.8%*30/90). Based on 60 working days and 30 we/ph earning mmf rate
Yea I also dumped into Philip MMF after deposited into tiger trade. 5.5% is good  better than bonds. Thanks.

I thought the total return after factoring in MMF return is $1117.80 as indicated in the TnC after 60 trading days ?Not sure how to interpret the TnC. My interpretation is after 60 trading days  you get about $1117.80(including the daily interest +  guaranteed return from coupon).
Yeah it's also unclear to me. 4.5% is correct if they just take 1117 net off whatever change in fund nav after 60 trading days. see if anyone else have past exp with tiger 6.8%
I wonder if they want to us to move to non credit card cashless payment like paynow and the likes.
The lady staff at Suntec did tell me to subscribe to Philips MMF to earn more than the promo rate 6.8%  so you are correct to also include 2.8% for the 60 working days + period 9 Nov-23 Nov
